definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Robinovitz pushed past the queue jamming the passageway outside the infirmary .
sentences.chinese: 羅賓諾維茨擠過在醫務室門外阻塞了通道的長隊。

sentences.english: Pope turns and addresses a man investigating the door to the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: Pope轉身與勘查醫務室門的一個男子交談。

sentences.english: The cons move through the halls to the infirmary door.
sentences.chinese: 團伙們穿過了過道，來到醫務室門口。

sentences.english: All they need now are the keys to the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: 現在所需要的就是醫務室的門鑰匙。

sentences.english: Some schools require students to keep their quick-relief inhalers in the health office.
sentences.chinese: 有些學校要求學生將吸入劑放在校醫務室。

sentences.english: Lee is the kid Mike carries into the Nurses office, right?
sentences.chinese: 李就是那個邁克攙扶着進醫務室的男生，對吧？

sentences.english: Where are the changing rooms, showers, doping control room and clinic?
sentences.chinese: 更衣室，淋浴，興奮劑檢測室和醫務室在哪裏？

sentences.english: Andy and Rooster MacBride went by way of the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: 安迪和盧斯特還先被送到監獄的醫務室療傷。

sentences.english: And if we can get to the infirmary, then we can get out of here.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們能進入醫務室，那麼我們就能逃出去。

sentences.english: Pope grills nurse Katie about the infirmary door being unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 獄長逼問護士Katie，爲何醫務室的門沒有鎖。

sentences.english: He’s getting out of the infirmary tonight.
sentences.chinese: 他今晚要從醫務室出來了。

sentences.english: What’s up there in that infirmary that you need so bad?
sentences.chinese: 醫務室有什麼好東西，你這麼想得到？

sentences.english: Michael, in handcuffs, is walked into the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: Michael戴着手銬走進了醫務室。

sentences.english: Michael waits outside one of the examination rooms in the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: Michael在醫務室的某一個檢查室外等候。

sentences.english: Like I said, the sickbay 's the place to look.
sentences.chinese: 就像我說的，醫務室是值得一看的地方。

sentences.english: I figure it’s going to take at least five minutes to get the bars off the window in the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲至少得5分鐘我們弄掉醫務室窗戶的柵欄。

definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to help a mother give birth
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to make a bed/to lay bedding
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
